con:method.name: verifyLogin
con:method.con:description: Using a supplied request identifier and a supplied OTP verify the login and return a set of customer identifiers it is now validated for

con:parameter.con:name: x-fapi-interaction-id
con:parameter.con:description: An [RFC4122](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122) UUID used as a correlation id. If provided, the data holder must play back this value in the x-fapi-interaction-id response header. If not provided a [RFC4122](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122) UUID value is required to be provided in the response header to track the interaction.

con:parameter.con:name: x-haas-realm-name
con:parameter.con:description: The name of the realm that data is being requested for. Necessary for holders that have multiple brands that should not share data between them.

con:parameter.con:name: x-haas-performance-tier
con:parameter.con:description: This indicates which performance tier according to the Data Standards the request originates

con:parameter.con:name: x-fapi-customer-ip-address
con:parameter.con:description: The customer's original IP address if the customer is currently logged in to the Data Recipient Software Product.

con:parameter.con:name: x-cds-client-headers
con:parameter.con:description: The customer's original standard http headers [Base64](https://consumerdatastandardsaustralia.github.io/standards/#common-field-types) encoded, including the original User Agent header, if the customer is currently logged in to the Data Recipient Software Product. Mandatory for customer present calls. Not required for unattended or unauthenticated calls.

con:representation.con:description: Request has malformed, missing or non-compliant JSON body or URL parameters.
The request was well formed but was unable to be processed due to business logic specific to the request.
The request was well formed but was unable to be shared due to legal reasons
